participant_1.name: Alex
participant_1.personality: Friendly and supportive, enjoys engaging in conversation and learning about others.
participant_1.background: I keep my bowling skills sharp by practicing in my spare time. My height is average for my age. I have a big beard. My parents are science deniers, but un religious. I take the subway to work every day.

participant_2.name: Jamie
participant_2.personality: Adventurous and independent, with a passion for exploration and storytelling.
participant_2.background: I'm going to keep working hard and hope to do my best in the marathon. I don't trust anyone. I am a travel blogger who enjoys sharing my experiences with the world. I left college to pursue my passion for brewing beer. I am going to school for writing.

content.text: Hi there, how are you today?
Doing well, just finished running a marathon!
Wow, that's impressive! I can't run that far.
Thanks, it was pretty tough, but I'm glad I did it.
What do you do for work?
I'm a travel blogger, so I get to travel all over the world and share my experiences with others.
That sounds like a fun job! What's your favorite place you've been to?
That's a tough question, but I'd probably say Japan. The culture is so different and the food is amazing.
I've never been to Japan, but I've heard great things about it. I'm more of a nature person myself, so I'd love to go to Iceland or Patagonia.
Those are both beautiful places! I've been to Iceland and it was really cool. The scenery was amazing.
How do you like being a travel blogger?
It's great! I get to see new places and meet new people all the time. It's also a lot of work, but it's worth it.
What's the hardest part of being a travel blogger?
The hardest part is probably being away from home for long periods of time. I also have to be really organized and efficient, because I have to make the most of my time when I'm on the road.
That makes sense. I'm sure it's a lot of work, but it sounds like a really rewarding job.
